Body: German is typically described as a Subject-Object-Verb language. For former American President Kennedy's mistake to be grammatical (i.e. without the indefinite article "ein"), why should it not have been: "Ich Berliner bin" (or "Ich ein Berliner bin")?
Title: German is SOV: should it not have been "Ich ein Berliner bin"?

LastEditedUser.AboutMe: I am a software developer, who also happens to have a great many other interests in life. One of them is linguistics (and languages in general). My native language is Portuguese and, at the moment, I'm commited to the Portuguese Language & Usage proposal. If you love that language and admire its tradition as much as I do, please commit to it and be part of a great lusophone community!
